intro: Cacalia cordifolia, commonly known as heartleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and bell-like blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and thrives in partial to full shade. It is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and along the edges of ponds. Cacalia cordifolia is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
